meanings.definition: A person who works with iron, typically in construction or metalworking.
meanings.sent1: The skilled ironworker carefully welded the metal beams together.
meanings.sent2: The ironworker built a strong fence using iron bars.
meanings.sent3: The ironworker joked that they were 'ironing out' the details of the project.
meanings.sent4: The ironworker's determination was as solid as the iron they worked with.
meanings.sent5: The clang of the hammer in the hands of the ironworker echoed through the workshop.

meanings.definition: A machine or tool used for working with iron.
meanings.sent1: The heavy ironworker in the factory shaped the metal sheets effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The new ironworker was a great addition to the blacksmith's workshop.
meanings.sent3: The ironworker machine hummed along as it cut through the thick iron plates.
meanings.sent4: The precision of the ironworker tool was unmatched in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The sparks flew as the ironworker machine forged the metal into intricate designs.
